section.p: provides a Export Segments in tag groups function, which works across all or some documents of a folder.

section.title: Prerequisites
section.p: The folder must exist, and its documents must have been analyzed.

section.title: Calling sequence
section.p: You can start this function from a "Folder List" window or from a "Document List" window. Here the start from the "Document List"window is described.

Select:
One or more documents you want to processe from the "Document List" window
"Export segments in tag groups" from the "Utilities" menu The "Export segments inside given tag groups" window is displayed

plentry.pd: here the list of processed documents is displayed.

plentry.pt: File containing list of start/stop tags

pd.p: Here the name of the file containing the start/stop tags is entered. You can also click Browse to display the "Select file containing list of start/stop tags" window on which you can select the appropriate file name.
The list of start/stop tags is a plain text file. Each text line of the file contains a start and stop tag separated by a comma. The start and stop tag can be enclosed in double-quotes.

plentry.pd: Here the name of the output file is entered. You can also click Browse to display the "Select output file" window on which you can select the appropriate file name.
Stops the search and the interaction with this window and returns you to the starting point.

section.title: Results
section.p: The segments contained in the text groups are exported to the selected output file.
